page.title: 14FARMING IN LEADENHAM
page.content: There are eleven farmers involved in the agriculture of this area.They are mainly tenant farmers who lease the Leadenham Estate.Farm workers are usually accommodated in tied houses. The soil in this area is of two types. The land on the Heath towards Sleaford is limestone based,drains well and is easily worked.The fields towards Newark,on the other hand,are heavy clay based and require a great deal in the way of drainage and ditching.A large part of the farming is arable with only a relatively small area used for grazing.One farmer has a flock of 300-400 sheep.Most of the stock is beef cattle,mainly Charolais and other continental crosses.Colonel Reeve is the only farmer locally with a dairy herd. This is a herd of Shorthorns,now quite unusual.
